thread.title: Al's Burger Shack owner to open commissary in Carrboro
thread.title_full: Al's Burger Shack owner to open commissary in Carrboro

title: Al's Burger Shack owner to open commissary in Carrboro
text:
Al's Burger Shack owner to open commissary in Carrboro Tags: Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters More on this Al's Burger Shack 
Chapel Hill, N.C. — Al Bowers, the owner of Al's Burger Shack in Chapel Hill, and his wife, Melody, announced plans Friday to open a lunch-only commissary in downtown Carrboro. 
Mel's Commissary and Lucheonette will be located at 109 West Main St. and will serve up seasonal comfort food weekdays 11 a.m. until 3 p.m. It is expected to open in March. The space will also serve as a commissary kitchen for Al's Burger Shack , Burger Truck and AlMel's Catering company. 
“In many ways Mel’s is a tribute to Mama and all the female southern cooks whose stoves I learned from,” Melody Bowers said. “Our soups, salads and entrees will focus on traditional flavors with some cool twists. The commissary side of the business will serve an overdue need in Al and I’s catering and shack business, but Mel’s Luncheonette will be a labor of love.” 
The lunch menu will change daily and will feature items like pork green chili, avocado salad and chicken and pastry. Fans of the catering menu's deviled eggs will be happy to know that they will likely be serving those up on a regular basis.
